item.description:
Critical Mass is an unorganized coincidence....of bicycles...on the streets of New Haven!

Come out and celebrate human-powered transport in a parade of sorts! Dress for the weather (gardening gloves are comfy), wear a helmet, and light up those blinkie bike lights!

The group meets at the flagpole on the New Haven Green, which is across the street from City Hall. The ride leaves by 6p, but has been known to depart by 5:45p. Get there early and introduce yourself!

Call me if you have any questions about the event. Eric: 860-214-9361.

The ride usually ends at a house party (BYOB) or local pub; in the "off-season" rides generally terminate at a local drinking establishment. Bring some cash and a festive attitude! The ride itself is slow-paced, non-intimidating, safe, and fun. Obey traffic laws (ie; it's illegal to ride on the sidewalk) and have fun!

See: http://www.elmcitycyc... for rider safety info.
item.how_to_find_us: will be on a blue Fuji fixed gear, reflective-taped pants legs ;)
item.why: Biking is good for you! Biking on the STREET (where you're supposed to ride) with 25+ other people is a lot of fun! It's like a monthly parade that you're IN.
item.name: March Critical Mass Bicycle Ride! 5:30p New Haven Green
